0.text: (CNN)A mammoth fire broke out Friday morning in a Kentucky industrial park, sending plumes of thick smoke over the area as authorities worked to contain the damage. The blaze began shortly before 7 a.m. at the General Electric Appliance Park in Louisville, according to Mike Weimer from the city's emergency management agency. He said that there were no reports of anyone injured or trapped. Video showed both smoke and bright orange flames. Firefighters took up positions around the affected buildings, spraying water from the periphery. Weimer told CNN that authorities didn't know what had caused the fire, which had gone to at least four alarms. According to a GE website, its facility in the Louisville Appliance Park is "revitalizing manufacturing in the United States." The park is large, such that 34 football fields could fit in one of its warehouses in the facility.
0.golden:
Fire breaks out at the General Electric Appliance Park in Louisville, Kentucky .
City official: No is believed to be injured or trapped .
0.notion: A massive fire broke out at the General Electric Appliance Park in Louisville, Kentucky, causing thick smoke and bright orange flames. Firefighters worked to contain the blaze, and there were no reports of injuries or trapped individuals. The cause of the fire is unknown, and the facility is described as revitalizing manufacturing in the United States.
0.grammarly: A massive fire broke out at the General Electric Appliance Park in Louisville, Kentucky. No injuries were reported, but the blaze caused significant damage to the park. Firefighters were working to contain the fire, which had gone up to at least four alarms. The cause of the fire is currently unknown. The facility is a large one and is capable of fitting 34 football fields in one of its warehouses.
0.current_doc_summarizier: A large fire broke out Friday morning in the General Electric Appliance Park in Louisville, Kentucky. No injuries or people trapped were reported. Video showed smoke and orange flames. Firefighters were spraying water from the periphery to contain the blaze, which had gone to at least four alarms. The Louisville Appliance Park is a large facility owned by GE, which is 'revitalizing manufacturing in the United States'. It is so large that 34 football fields could fit in one of its warehouses.
0.current_update_summarizer: A large fire broke out Friday morning in the General Electric Appliance Park in Louisville, Kentucky. No injuries or people trapped were reported. Video showed smoke and orange flames. Firefighters were spraying water from the periphery to contain the blaze, which had gone to at least four alarms. The Louisville Appliance Park is a large facility owned by GE, which is 'revitalizing manufacturing in the United States'. It is so large that 34 football fields could fit in one of its warehouses.

1.text: Hull, Leicester and Swansea City are following Poland international winger Maciej Rybus. Stan Ternent, Hull's chief scout has watched the 25-year-old playing for Russian side Terek Grozny. He has one year left on his current deal and has a get-out clause for £3.2million. Poland international Maciej Rybus (right) is being followed by Hull, Leicester and Swansea . Rybus impressed during Poland's 1-1 draw with Republic of Ireland last month. The former Legia Warsaw player made his debut for his country in Franciszek Smuda's first match in charge, a friendly versus Romania in November 2009, but has been used predominately as a substitute. He then scored his first goal for Poland four days later in a match against Canada. In 27 appearances for club and country this season, Rybus has scored three goals. Rybus impressed during Poland's 1-1 draw with Republic of Ireland in Dublin last month .
1.golden:
Hull's chief scout Stan Ternent has watched  Maciej Rybus in Russia .
Rybus is a Poland international and plays for Terek Grozny .
Premier League rivals Leicester and Swansea are also interested .
The 25-year-old has one year left on contract and has £3.2m release clause .
1.notion: Hull, Leicester, and Swansea City are interested in signing Polish winger Maciej Rybus. Hull's chief scout has watched the 25-year-old play for Russian side Terek Grozny. Rybus has one year left on his contract with a release clause of £3.2 million. He has impressed during international matches and has scored three goals in 27 appearances this season.
1.grammarly: Hull, Leicester, and Swansea City are interested in signing Poland international winger Maciej Rybus. The 25-year-old currently plays for Russian side Terek Grozny and has a get-out clause for £3.2 million. Rybus impressed during Poland's 1-1 draw with Republic of Ireland last month, and has scored three goals in 27 appearances for club and country this season.

He currently plays for Russian side Terek Grozny and has one year left on his current deal with a get-out clause of £3.2million. Rybus has made 27 appearances for club and country this season, scoring three goals. He made his debut for Poland in 2009 and scored his first goal four days later. He impressed during Poland's 1-1 draw with Republic of Ireland last month.

Rybus has made 27 appearances for club and country this season, scoring three goals. He made his debut for Poland in 2009 and scored his first goal four days later. He impressed during Poland's 1-1 draw with Republic of Ireland last month.

2.text: Sportsmail have teamed up with Golfbidder to offer one lucky reader the chance to win a bundle of Callaway golf clubs and accessories worth more than £1,300. The exclusive Golfbidder.co.uk competition prize bundle includes a Callaway XR Driver, Callaway XR 3 Wood, Callaway XR Hybrid and a set of Callaway XR Irons. Golfbidder. one of the UK’s busiest online golf retailers, has also thrown in a dozen Callaway Chrome Soft golf balls as part of this superb golf package. 3.text: The time is right for Manchester United target Mats Hummels to make the switch to the Premier League, according to Germany legend Franz Beckenbauer. The World Cup winning defender has been consistently linked with a move to Old Trafford in recent seasons and with Dortmund likely to miss out on European football next season, Hummels is considering his future. Beckenbauer, who won 103 caps for West Germany, can believes Hummels is at the perfect point in his career to leave Jurgen Klopp's side. Mats Hummels has admitted he is considering his future at Borussia Dortmund . The Germany defender has consistently been linked with a big-money move to Manchester United . 'At 26, Hummels is at the best age to make the move to England,' he told Bild. 'I can understand his thinking well.' Hummels gave an interview in Kicker magazine last week in which he demanded a stronger Dortmund team for next season, otherwise he may consider his own future. And Hummels reiterated that he was weighing up his options after Dortmund's defeat by Bayern at the weekend. Germany legend Franz Beckenbauer believes Hummels is at the right age to leave Dortmund . Hummels closes down Mario Gotze during Dortmund's 1-0 defeat by Bayern Munich on Saturday . 'That doesn't mean that I am leaving, it just means I'm reflecting,' he told Sky television following a 1-0 defeat to Bayern Munich at the weekend. 'There's no particular tendency one way or the other. It's just thoughts going through my mind. It will all become clearer in the coming weeks.
3.golden:
Mats Hummels admits he is considering his Borussia Dortmund future .
Germany defender is being linked with a move to Manchester United .
Franz Beckenbauer says he is at perfect age to move to Premier League .
3.notion: Germany legend Franz Beckenbauer believes that Mats Hummels is at the right age to make a move to the Premier League, specifically Manchester United. With Borussia Dortmund likely to miss out on European football next season, Hummels is considering his future and has expressed his desire for a stronger team. While he has not confirmed his departure, he is reflecting on his options and will make a decision in the coming weeks.
3.grammarly: German football legend Franz Beckenbauer has said that the time is right for Borussia Dortmund defender Mats Hummels to move to the Premier League, with Manchester United tipped to sign him. The Germany international has been consistently linked with a big-money move to the Old Trafford outfit in recent seasons and with Dortmund likely to miss out on European football next season, Hummels is considering his future. The 26-year-old World Cup winner has admitted he is considering his future at the German club and would like a stronger team for next season.
3.current_doc_summarizier: Germany legend Franz Beckenbauer believes that Mats Hummels is at the perfect age to make the switch to the Premier League, with Manchester United being the likely destination. Hummels has admitted he is considering his future at Borussia Dortmund and has demanded a stronger team for next season. He has reiterated that he is weighing up his options after Dortmund's defeat by Bayern Munich at the weekend. Hummels has not made a decision yet, but he will make it clear in the coming weeks.
3.current_update_summarizer: Mats Hummels is considering his future at Borussia Dortmund and has been linked with a move to Manchester United. Germany legend Franz Beckenbauer believes Hummels is at the perfect age to make the switch to the Premier League. Hummels has admitted he is reflecting on his future and will make a decision in the coming weeks. He has demanded a stronger Dortmund team for next season or he may consider leaving.

4.text: Jose Mourinho insists Manchester United's injury crisis does not weaken their team as they head to Chelsea for tomorrow's title clash. United boss Louis van Gaal revealed he will be without Marcos Rojo, Phil Jones, Michael Carrick and Daley Blind at Stamford Bridge, but Mourinho responded by listing their lavish squad. 'I disagree because their squad is amazing, in numbers, players, experience, solutions,' said the Chelsea manager. Jose Mourinho believes Manchester United will not be weakened by injury problems when they play Chelsea . Louis van Gaal is without a number of key players ahead of the tough trip to Stamford Bridge . Chelsea defender Branislav Ivanovic pictured on the ball during Chelsea's training session on Friday . Defender Gary Cahill plays the ball during training as Chelsea prepare for Manchester United's visit . Didier Drogba tries to find a way past Denmark under 21 defender Andreas Christensen in training . Chelsea currently enjoy a seven-point lead in the Premier League title race with a game in hand . 'Their squad is amazing. Every week I have on the big screen in my office not the team I'm going to play against, but the squad and all the options. 'This week, when I arrived in the room, for the first time in the week, I realised what they have. It's amazing.' 'You want me to name their players? Mata, Di Maria, Januzaj, Rooney, Van Persie, Herrera, Carrick, Blind, Fellaini... 'Defenders? Rafael and Valencia, Luke Shaw left-back, centre-backs Smalling... of course they don't have Evans and Jones, but Blackett, McNair. They have played. Van Gaal is a fantastic coach to develop players. 'These kids have played a lot of matches and are more than ready. I went to QPR with Drogba and no strikers on the bench and, for a long time, because of suspensions or injuries, we were in trouble. 'You have to cope with it. I know Mr Van Gaal very well, and he's the kind of person to think at this moment that we have a fantastic squad and will go with what we have. Injuries are part of the game.' Eden Hazard (left) and Dominic Solanke pictured during Friday's training session at Cobham . Loic Remy, who has recovered from a calf injury, on the ball during training on Friday . Mourinho is relishing the meeting with Manchester United, saying his players require no motivation . Old friends Mourinho and Van Gaal embrace ahead of the fixture at Old Trafford back in October . Mourinho was part of Van Gaal's coaching staff during his time at Barcelona in the late nineties . Sports analysts BSports predict that a Chelsea win is easily the most likely outcome at Stamford Bridge . April 18 Manchester United (H) April 26 Arsenal (A) April 29 Leicester City (A) May 3 Crystal Palace (H) May 10 Liverpool (H) May 18 West Bromwich Albion (A) May 24 Sunderland (H) Mourinho and Van Gaal have a close relationship, dating back to the time when they worked together at Barcelona. 'I consider him a big, big, big, big friend,' said Mourinho. 'But with our jobs at the moment, with clubs with the same objectives, we are not speaking every week. But a deep feeling of a big friend, that doesn't change.' Mourinho said his players needed no motivation this week as they prepare to face United in what is always a 'special fixture.' He said games such as Saturday night's showdown at Stamford Bridge make his job 'easy' because 'every player is desperate to play and focused.' He said: 'To play Manchester United is to play one of the biggest clubs in the world and one of the best in the Premier League and this is what everybody wants. 'I am not worried this week about motivating players because there is no need. [It is an] easy job. It is a special fixture, it is a big match. 'You have to play everybody home and away and our fight is always to have the same motivation regardless of the opponent, but the reality is these matches are the easy ones where every player is desperate to play and focused.' Masked man Cesc Fabregas prepares for the visit of Manchester United on Saturday night . Winger Juan Cuadrado challenges Filipe Luis for the ball during a practice match at Cobham . Felipe Luis chases Eden Hazard to try and retrieve the ball in Friday's training session . Didier Drogba gave Chelsea the lead when the two teams met at Old Trafford earlier in the season . Robin van Persie earned a draw for Manchester United with a stoppage time equaliser in October . Former Chelsea player Juan Mata is preparing return to Stamford Bridge for the first time since his move . Mourinho sanctioned the sale of Mata to Manchester United for £37m last January . Juan Mata returns to Stamford Bridge as a United player for the first time since his £37m move to Old Trafford last January but Mourinho predicted he will get a good reception. 'He is a player with history at this club. We have deep respect for him and we wished him the best. If things are going well for him everybody is happy. He is a very correct boy and a top professional.' Chelsea can move 10 points clear of second-placed Arsenal - who take on Reading in the FA cup semi-final at the same time - with three points against United. They are boosted by the likely return of striker Loic Remy from a calf injury and Mourinho also confirmed that 19-goal frontman Diego Costa will return to full training next week after making a quick recovery from a hamstring problem. This puts the Spain international in contention for next weekend's top-of-the-table clash with Arsenal at the Emirates. Costa injured his hamstring in the win over Stoke City at Stamford Bridge on April 4 . Mourinho hinted that Loic Remy should return from a calf injury against Manchester United . Mourinho said on Costa: 'He is progressing very well. He has a chance for next weekend. Our target was for Diego to play our last four matches and Arsenal is the sixth from the end, so if he doesn't play it's not a problem but things are going so well he has a chance. 'He's training and he starts with the rest of the squad next week.' Mourinho wasn't willing to comment on figures revealed on Friday that show Chelsea have the worst behaviour towards referees in the Premier League. ܎ .
4.golden:
United are without Marcos Rojo, Phil Jones, Michael Carrick and Daley Blind for Stamford Bridge showdown .
But Mourinho says Louis van Gaal's 'amazing' squad will cope .
Chelsea boss said he players needed no motivation for United fixture .
Blues can move a step closer to Premier League title with three points .
Click here for all the team news, stats and odds ahead of the game .
4.notion: Jose Mourinho believes Manchester United's injury crisis will not weaken their team as they face Chelsea. Despite missing key players, Mourinho listed United's squad as 'amazing' and capable of coping with the situation. Mourinho and Louis van Gaal have a close relationship, but Mourinho stated that their friendship doesn't change the competitive nature of their clubs. Chelsea currently holds a seven-point lead in the Premier League title race and is looking forward to the match against United.
4.current_doc_summarizier: Jose Mourinho believes Manchester United will not be weakened by injury problems when they face Chelsea in a title clash at Stamford Bridge. Mourinho insists that United's squad is 'amazing' in terms of numbers, players, experience, and solutions. He also believes that Louis van Gaal is a fantastic coach to develop players and that his players need no motivation for the match. Mourinho and Van Gaal have a close relationship, dating back to their time at Barcelona. Chelsea are boosted by the likely return of striker Loic Remy from a calf injury and Diego Costa from a hamstring injury. Mourinho hinted that Costa has a chance to play against Arsenal in the next match.
4.current_update_summarizer: Jose Mourinho believes Manchester United will not be weakened by injury problems when they face Chelsea in a title clash at Stamford Bridge. He believes the squad is 'amazing' in terms of numbers, players, experience, and solutions, and that Louis van Gaal is a fantastic coach to develop players. Mourinho and Van Gaal have a close relationship, and Chelsea are boosted by the likely return of Loic Remy and Diego Costa from injuries. Mourinho hinted that Costa has a chance to play against Arsenal in the next match.

5.text:
We’ve made a few updates to Workforms recently, so we thought we’d summarise the enhancements into a  short and sweet  post for our community!
NEW UPDATES
• The People Column is now supported: Assign an item to a person or team without creating an automation!
• 1:1 question format
COMING SOON 
• The Connect Board Column: Specify which items of the connected board are related to his/her submission.
• Submission analytics page: Take reporting to the next level, pull insightful analytics such as submission rate, average submission time, and split by geolocation, browser, and device of the form submitters.
Check out more details here 24 and stay tuned!
5.notion: Workforms has introduced new updates including support for the People Column and a 1:1 question format. Coming soon are enhancements such as the Connect Board Column for specifying related items and a submission analytics page for detailed reporting.
5.grammarly: Workforms has recently undergone updates, including support for the People Column and a 1:1 question format. The Connect Board Column and a submission analytics page are also coming soon. Check out the details on their website.
5.current_doc_summarizier: Workforms has recently released several updates, including the People Column, 1:1 question format, the Connect Board Column, and the Submission analytics page. These updates will allow users to assign items to people or teams, specify which items of the connected board are related to the submission, and take reporting to the next level with analytics such as submission rate, average submission time, and split by geolocation, browser, and device of the form submitters. For more information, check out the link provided.
5.current_update_summarizer: Workforms has recently been updated with two new features: the People Column, which allows users to assign an item to a person or team without creating an automation, and the 1:1 question format. Coming soon are the Connect Board Column, which allows users to specify which items of the connected board are related to their submission, and the Submission Analytics page, which provides reporting such as submission rate, average submission time, and split by geolocation, browser, and device of the form submitters. For more information, check out the link provided.
